alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 8:46PM CDT until May 02 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Sand Hill River at Climax affecting Polk County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94) affecting Cass County. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Walsh, Kittson, Marshall and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Polk, Grand Forks and Marshall Counties. Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Norman and Traill Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. .Red River basin river flooding to continue. Additional snow melt and precipitation later this week could affect the northern points along the Red. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY, MAY 02... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo. * WHEN...Until Tuesday, May 02. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, MAJOR FLOOD. Approximate stage where flooding begins in areas along the Sheyenne River north of the diversion channel to Harwood, ND. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Monday the stage was 20.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM CDT Monday was 21.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
